meanings.definition: In poor or bad condition; inferior in quality.
meanings.sent1: The old car looked even crummier after the hailstorm.
meanings.sent2: The new phone was much crummier than the one I had before.
meanings.sent3: The crummier sandwich fell apart as soon as I picked it up.
meanings.sent4: The crummier weather matched my mood perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The crummier paint job made the house seem neglected and uncared for.

meanings.definition: Feeling or looking dirty or shabby.
meanings.sent1: Her crummier clothes were a result of playing in the mud.
meanings.sent2: The crummier rug in the hallway needed a good cleaning.
meanings.sent3: I felt crummier than ever after rolling in the grass.
meanings.sent4: The crummier appearance of the room made it seem abandoned.
meanings.sent5: The crummier shoes were covered in dirt and scuff marks.

meanings.definition: Making someone feel unhappy or disappointed.
meanings.sent1: The crummier news about the event cancellation upset everyone.
meanings.sent2: Her crummier attitude brought down the whole mood of the party.
meanings.sent3: The crummier ending to the movie left me feeling unsatisfied.
meanings.sent4: The crummier feedback on my work made me doubt my abilities.
meanings.sent5: The crummier outcome of the game left the team feeling defeated.
